text:
Hello all! :sparkler:
I am here to ask about images management in HubSpot
Why images pasted into blog content have srcset attribute and those within custom modules do not have that?
I am sharing example below - I would really love to have srcset also in my module images as they are optimized then
Left (blog content), right (custom module image, srcset are not generated for any of formats - .jpegs, .pngs, .webp )

I have also found <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/files/automatic-image-resizing-on-HubSpot-content|an article that says> that images within a content (rich text) are automatically resized, meaning that image modules are not, is there a way to switch it on for image modules?

EDIT: Solved - actually adding exact width and height to module makes images to resize (see comment in a thread)
srcset will be automatically added to images if on the image you set width and height attributes
yes I just found this out!!!! thank you Federico! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello Everyone,
The fetching of the form fields from the url parameter is not working, how do i fixed that ?

My non-HubSpot Form isn’t being tracked for some reason for the #user-register-form. What am I missing? Is there anything that you can see wrong with the registration form or network tab?

*Please note that this same website successfully tracks form submissions from the non-HubSpot Form #user-form.

Dev site: <https://dev-example-native-opigno-two.pantheonsite.io/>

Anyone know how to optimize Serve images in next-gen formats that can improve the score?
I know that HubSpot served as a WebP but lighthouse just looks at the .jpg or .png extension.

I have noticed hs will not serve some images as webp – sometimes their conversion fails….

It’s a catch 22 bc hs img resizer does not work on manually uploaded webps

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
I can see that from site to site, any solutions to fix Serve images in next-gen formats?
usually we just upload an optimized and tinier version of the image(s) throwing the error and it sometimes fixes it
otherwise, we move on since most are lazy loaded. A 100 lighthouse score is not worth obsessing over for us
I want to create a blog that displays future scheduled posts only. Any ideas on how this can be done?
